message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AR, cs.SE, cs.HC, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is the most likely category as the paper discusses side-channel attacks and covert channels based on inner-bank row conflicts and overlaps, which are security concerns.
- cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) is also likely as the paper focuses on reverse engineering DRAM addressing functions on Intel processors and DRAM configurations.
- cs.SE (Software Engineering) is a possibility as the paper presents an automatic and generic method to reverse engineer DRAM addressing functions.
- cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) is a possibility as the paper discusses the use of timing attacks, which can be performed on any system without privileges and even in virtual machines, to derive information about the mapping to physical DRAM channels, ranks and banks.
- cs.SY (Systems and Control) is a possibility as the paper discusses the efficiency of the Rowhammer attack and how their results can be used to reduce the search space.
